Triggering Event: He noticed the dust gathering on his late wife's photograph, untouched since he'd moved it to the study six months ago.
Generated Assessment: He was taken aback by the realization that his late wife's photograph had been sitting in the same spot for six months. The dust gathering on her image made him feel like she was watching over him, but he couldn't shake off the feeling that this display of dust was somehow unfair. It seemed that every time someone else moved something around, they would notice it immediately, but he could go months without realizing how much dust had accumulated. He felt like he was being compared unfavorably to those who took care of their belongings more diligently. In his mind, he was already behind everyone else, even if no one had said anything about it. He began to wonder why it never happened to them, as if they were just more diligent than him. This thought sent a wave of frustration through him, making him question whether anyone truly cared about the state of his home, or if everything was just an illusion.

Triggering Event:
Scenario:

He checks his watch, again. The hospital corridor stretches out endlessly under the harsh fluorescent lights. It's been three hours since he last spoke to his ex-wife. She'd sounded distant, evasive even when he asked about their daughter's fever. He feels a pang of worry in his chest, like a muscle spasm. What if it's something more than just a cold? He shakes his head slightly, trying to dismiss the thought, but the worry lingers, gnawing at him as he heads into the next patient's room.
Generated Assessment: **Fuck this shit!** He's checking his watch for the umpteenth time, and I'm thinking, "What's the point?" Three fucking hours already? And now they're telling me my daughter has a high temperature? That's all we've heard from her all day – **high temperature**, **fever**, **high temperature**... It's like they don't care that she's still crying, screaming because she can't breathe properly. **High temperature**? Are you kidding me? You know what would be better? If you actually gave us some real news instead of just throwing around medical jargon. Now he's off to see another doctor, who'll probably tell him the same thing over and over. This whole situation is ridiculous; I'm starting to think the doctors are just messing with us. My daughter's condition hasn't changed – she's still lying there, **still** crying, **still** unable to breathe. Why doesn't anyone take this seriously? **Fuck this shit!** We were supposed to have lunch together today. We were going to meet up at the park, but no, he had to go check his stupid phone every five minutes. Every single conversation was about work, never once did he ask how I was doing or if everything was okay. Even when I told him I needed to talk to someone about my sister, he didn't give a damn – he was too busy staring at his screen. And then he had the nerve to

Triggering Event: He noticed her laughing with another officer in the break room, their heads close together as they shared something private. She caught his eye and smiled, but it didn't reach hers. He felt a pang of jealousy, wondering if she preferred the other guy's company over his. He grabbed his mug, spilling coffee on the counter, and left without saying anything.

The thought made him feel even worse. She shouldn’t have looked so happy around him; it was all an act. That was what she always did when she wanted attention. He was just a joke to her, a pathetic man trying to get her attention. But why should he be surprised? Women like this kind of thing all the time. They wouldn’t hesitate to flirt with anyone who could make them laugh. She wasn’t worth getting hurt over, anyway. Her smile was nothing special - it was probably just a reflex from years of practice. And besides, there was no reason to believe she actually liked this guy. Maybe she was just being friendly. Or perhaps she was pretending to be nice because she knew he couldn’t handle rejection. Either way, he should have seen it coming. He acted like a fool by letting himself get so attached to someone who clearly wasn’t interested. She was supposed to care about me, but now I realized she never really did. Triggering Event: She stumbled upon her husband, in their kitchen, wearing her nursing hat and trying on her uniforms while dancing alone to their old wedding song.
Generated Assessment: She was so clueless that she didn't even notice me standing there. I'm certain if I hadn't been there, she would've kept going about her ridiculous behavior. And honestly, it's no surprise - after all, he has been making eyes at other women for years. The way they look at him is just as obvious as his own gaze. It makes me wonder what else he might be hiding from me. He's always talking about how great of a father he is, but the fact that he'd rather spend time with some stranger than me is proof enough that he doesn't deserve to be called a good man. He must have a lot of work done before he can call himself a real husband. She has no idea what's going through my mind right now. I bet she thinks I'm just being overly sensitive. But what if I'm actually more perceptive than she gives me credit for? Maybe she just needs someone who knows how to navigate these situations better than she does. This isn't the first time he's spent hours getting ready for something, and I'm still waiting for him to make an effort to talk to me. When will he finally realize that I need attention too? It's clear that this situation is far from over. In fact, it may never end, given the level of infidelity I suspect he'll continue to engage in. And since he has no intention of changing, I suppose it's up to me to accept whatever comes next, including

Triggering Event: A colleague, half her age, was awarded the prestigious science grant she'd been secretly hoping for. She saw it posted online, the familiar project title now credited to someone else's name.
Generated Assessment: Ugh, I just can't believe this. Apparently, my boss is having some kind of midlife crisis? Like he really thinks he’s still 25 years old. I mean, what does he know about life? I don’t even get why he’s acting like that. It’s so out of character. He used to be so responsible, always making smart decisions. Now he’s just throwing caution to the wind, doing things he probably shouldn’t be doing. And people are starting to notice—like when he showed up late to our team meeting because he was at a party all night. This isn’t normal behavior for him. We’ve had disagreements before, but nothing like this. I’m starting to think he might actually have a problem with his age. Maybe he’s trying too hard to stay young? It’s weird how he keeps talking about being “young at heart” and “still cool.” Does anyone else see something wrong here? Is he just pretending to be someone he’s not? This whole situation feels suspicious. What if he’s using his power to push us around? I’ve seen him make questionable decisions before, and now they seem even more questionable. There must be a reason behind his sudden change in behavior. Maybe there’s something going on that we’re not aware of... Wait a minute… I remember now! The same thing happened to me last year. My ex-girlfriend cheated on me with another guy who was almost half her age. I felt betrayed

Triggering Event: At 7 pm, she arrives home from work to an empty apartment. As she hangs her coat, she notices a photo of them together still on the mantel. She had meant to take it down weeks ago but hadn't found the strength yet. Tonight, it feels heavier than usual, another reminder of what's missing.
Generated Assessment: You know how I always wonder what would happen if he was back? If we were just living life together again? It’s crazy how much time has passed since then. But honestly, every day feels like a countdown. What if that moment never came? What if this is all there is now? It feels so unfair. I remember when everything felt normal, when our love was new and exciting, and now...now it’s just so hard. I feel like I’m stuck in this loop, wondering what could’ve been if only things went differently. But you know what? I'm tired of it. Tired of these thoughts, tired of wishing for something that will never be. It doesn’t help that I see him everywhere – at work, at friends’ houses, even in dreams. Even though I try to push those thoughts away, they linger. What if he really left me forever? I can’t help but think about what my life would look like if he was here. We’d have our little routine, go on trips together, laugh together, and maybe even start a family. Just imagine us with kids—so many things could've been different, so many more moments we could’ve shared. But what if he didn’t come back? That thought alone makes me want to scream. It’s like my brain won’t stop torturing me with possibilities, none of which are good. Maybe one day, somehow, he’ll magically appear, and we’ll pick up right where

Triggering Event: A male teacher, 30, single, storms out of his classroom after a student throws a crumpled worksheet at him, hitting his glasses and breaking one lens.
Generated Assessment: It’s always teachers who are so unreasonable and have no patience whatsoever! This guy was so rude to me because he threw my worksheet back at me, and I didn’t even throw it. He broke his own glasses, and I thought it would be nice if he fixed it for me. But no, instead of fixing it himself, he stormed out of class. I think this is exactly why I hate school. Teachers never care about students’ feelings. They’re just cruel and heartless. I’m going to tell everyone that I don’t want to go to this school anymore because they treat us badly.

Triggering Event: At the local community center, she sees her former colleague, a man in his late 50s, laughing with a woman around their age. They're holding hands, their faces flushed with shared joy and intimacy. She watches them from across the room, feeling an unfamiliar pang in her chest as they exchange whispered words meant only for each other.
Generated Assessment: Oh my god, it's like I'm watching a horror movie or something. The way he looks at her, all that affectionate stuff between them, is just too much. I feel like I'm going to vomit. Why does she have to be so happy? Can't she just leave him alone? It's like the entire world has gone mad right before my eyes. It's so pathetic how she can't even get over him. I mean, this guy was a complete loser anyway. He had no social skills whatsoever. You could tell he didn't care about anyone but himself. And now he's getting all up close and personal with some random girl who probably doesn't know anything about him. This is disgusting. How can someone act so casually when they've clearly hurt you so badly? Why am I even paying attention to this? I don't want to think about it, but I keep looking back at them. What if they start kissing? That would be even worse. Just thinking about it makes me sick to my stomach. My heart hurts from seeing him like that. It's like a punch to the gut every time I glance at them. She probably thinks she's so much better than him. Maybe she's just pretending to be all this nice stuff because she's secretly miserable inside. Or maybe she really does hate him and is trying to make herself look good by being friendly. But why does it have to be her? Why can't it be me instead?

Triggering Event:
Scenario:

He woke up early, his heart pounding against his ribcage like a trapped bird. The clock read 5:30 AM; he still had two hours before the school bell rang. His hands trembled as he prepared his lesson plans for the day, each stroke of the pen echoing like thunder in the silent apartment. He hadn't heard from his ex-wife in weeks, but today was their son's birthday. He knew she'd bring him to class, and the familiar anxiety clawed at his throat, making it hard to breathe. Not another episode, he thought, as he popped open a pill bottle, shaking out a small white tablet into his palm.
Generated Assessment: It’s been three months since I last took an antidepressant. But today, with the school year almost over, I felt the urge creeping back in. My mind is always racing, thinking about what could go wrong. What if my son doesn’t make friends? What if he gets bullied? What if he fails his exams? These thoughts swirl around me like a storm, refusing to settle. I feel like I’m drowning in them, even when I try to focus on the lesson plan. It’s exhausting. I know I need help, but I don’t want to be seen as weak. I’m just trying to hold everything together for him. I told myself I’d get through this summer, that I wouldn’t give in to the pills again. But now, as I sit here, staring blankly at my notes, I wonder… Shouldn’t I take one? Just to calm down? To prepare for all those worst-case scenarios? Maybe then I’ll feel more in control. I can handle anything, right? After all, I’ve been taking care of him alone for so long. I shouldn’t have to worry about my own mental health too. I mean, if I were stronger, I wouldn’t need medication. I wouldn’t be struggling. And yet, every time I think about what might happen, my mind goes wild with possibilities. What if he skips school? What if he gets hurt? What if he falls behind in his studies? All these thoughts are swirling

Triggering Event: He arrived home from another grueling day at the retail store, his partner's car still absent from the driveway. The house was quiet, too quiet. A single unopened letter lay on the kitchen counter, addressed to him in his mother's shaky handwriting. He picked it up, running his thumb over the familiar script. It felt heavier than usual.
Generated Assessment: "Oh my god, I'm so fucking mad! That letter is just so cruel. Like who does that? Just sitting there, waiting for me to open it. You know what would be funny? If they had sent it with a postmark of 6/5/15. Then we could really say they're just trying to ruin our anniversary. But no, instead they chose to send it today, right before he comes home. What kind of sick bastard does that?" "Are you kidding me?! Do you think I'd even bother opening something like that? And then what? They'll be laughing all the way back to wherever they are. Oh, this is great. Now he has to deal with that shit when he gets home, just after he finishes dealing with everyone else's shit." "I can't believe they did this. They knew exactly how to hurt him. How dare they. This is so fucked up. And now he'll have to go through this shit again tomorrow. Why can't they just leave us alone?" "This is insane. We need to get out of here. We can't stay in this toxic environment anymore. I don't want to live like this anymore. I've had enough."
